subject: Learning
title: The Role of Sleep in Child Development
description: A quick win: understand The Role of Sleep in Child Development.

hook.text: Toddlers who nap after learning new words remember them. Toddlers who stay awake forget. Sleep is a learning tool.

buildup.text: Children need far more sleep than adults because sleep is when the brain consolidates learning and builds connections.

discovery.text: During sleep, the brain replays the day's experiences, strengthening important memories and pruning unneeded ones.

twist.text: Sleep-deprived children show symptoms that mimic ADHD: poor attention, impulsivity, and emotional dysregulation.

climax.text: Protecting sleep isn't just about rest. It's about giving the brain time to build itself properly.

punchline.text: Sleep isn't downtime for children. It's construction time for their brains.

quiz.question: Why do children need more sleep than adults?
options: Sleep is when the brain consolidates learning and builds neural connections
Children are simply lazier than adults
Sleep has no effect on child brain development
